abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment comprises
            three volumes, and examines the environmental impacts
            resulting from the construction of the Nabeul Arts Institute
            (v. 1), the university restaurant at l'Iset de Kairouan
            (v. 2), and, the Institute of Technology Studies at Kairouan
            (v.3). It reviews the physical, and biological aspects of
            the region, specifying that neither aspect will be
            threatened by construction, and implementation of the
            project. Nonetheless, construction at l'Iset will need
            special attention, for its location is among rural areas,
            potentially endangering agricultural lands. Environmental
            impacts, and mitigation measures address the following.
            Solid waste management will follow regulations, and
            technical control regarding appropriate waste disposal,
            including disposal of hazardous materials, such as chemicals
            and metal residues, as well as oil spills. Vegetation
            propagation will be practiced following construction.
            Wastewater discharges will be in accordance with the
            Sewerage Authority's (ONAS) regulations, to prevent
            wastewater discharges, particularly along the coast.
            Rainwater will be deviated through canals, to prevent
            adverse vegetation growth, - favorable to reptile/insect
            proliferation - and, to divert discharges from coastal
            areas. Socioeconomic aspects are expected to improve through
            employment generation, while, architectural choices will
            respect cultural heritage aspects.
